therianGuide.title: What is Being Therian?
therianGuide.subtitle: An introductory guide to understanding therianthropy with respect, curiosity and an open mind.
therianGuide.defP1: Therianthropy is an identity in which a person feels a deep, intrinsic connection with a non-human animal, on a spiritual, psychological level or both. This connection goes beyond simply "liking" an animal — it's feeling that a part of your identity is that animal.
therianGuide.defP2: People who identify as therians experience this connection in very diverse ways. Some describe it as something they have always felt, while others discover it gradually. There is no "correct" way to be therian.
therianGuide.importantText: The theriotype (the animal you identify with) is not something you choose — it's something you discover about yourself.

experiences.title: Mental Shift
experiences.description: Moments when your mindset aligns more with that of your theriotype. You may feel more instinctive, alert or connected to nature.

experiences.title: Phantom Shift
experiences.description: The sensation of having body parts of your theriotype (tail, ears, wings) even though you don't physically have them. Like a "phantom limb".

experiences.title: Dream Shift
experiences.description: Dreaming as your theriotype or having recurring dreams where you are your animal. Many therians discover their theriotype through dreams.

experiences.title: Nature Connection
experiences.description: Feeling a deep connection with the natural habitat of your theriotype, with nature in general, or with instinctive behaviors.

experiences.title: Quadrobics
experiences.description: The practice of moving on all fours, imitating the movements of your theriotype. It's a form of expression and exercise.

experiences.title: Awakening
experiences.description: The moment you first recognize your therian identity. It can be gradual or sudden, and it's a very personal experience.

differences.description: A person who intrinsically identifies with a terrestrial animal. It's an identity, not a hobby.
A broader term that includes identification with beings not necessarily animals (dragons, elves, etc.). Therians are a subgroup.
A fandom centered on anthropomorphic animal characters. It's a hobby/community. Someone can be furry without being therian and vice versa.
A concept from some indigenous cultures about animal spiritual guides. It's not the same as being therian. Use the term with cultural respect.

therianGuide.diffFootnote: These categories can overlap. A person can be therian and furry at the same time, for example. What matters is mutual respect.
therianGuide.wellbeingText: This site is a community and education space. It does not replace professional guidance. If you're going through a difficult time or need emotional support, we encourage you to seek help from a mental health professional. Your wellbeing always comes first.

glosario.title: Therian Glossary
glosario.subtitle: Important terms and concepts to understand the therian community.
glosario.backLink: ← Back to What is Being Therian?

termsList.definition: A person who intrinsically identifies with a non-human animal. This identity is not chosen but discovered.
The specific animal a therian identifies with. It can be an existing or extinct animal. Some therians have more than one theriotype (polytherian).
A broad term for people who identify as non-human beings. Includes therians but also identifications with mythical beings, elementals, etc.
A therian who identifies with more than one animal. Each theriotype can manifest differently.
A therian whose theriotype is not a specific species but a broader taxonomic group (e.g.: canines in general instead of grey wolf).
The moment or process through which a person recognizes and accepts their therian identity. It can be gradual or sudden.
An experience where a person's mindset temporarily aligns more with their theriotype. They may feel more instinctive or animal-like.
A physical sensation of having body parts of the theriotype (tail, ears, wings, etc.), similar to the medical concept of "phantom limb".
Dreams in which one experiences being the theriotype. Many therians discover or confirm their identity through recurring dreams.
A temporary shift involving an animal different from one's own theriotype. It does not indicate a new permanent theriotype.
Physical accessories like masks, tails, ears or collars that some therians use to express their identity. Their use is completely optional.
The practice of moving on all fours, imitating animal movement. It combines identity expression with physical exercise.
A fan or member of the furry fandom, centered on anthropomorphic animal characters. It's a hobby/community, not an identity. Someone can be furry and therian, or just one of the two.
An anthropomorphic animal character created by a member of the furry fandom. A fursona is a fictional character; a theriotype is an identity.
A group of therians who gather (online or offline) to share experiences and support each other.
An umbrella term for any person whose identity differs from the "standard" human experience. Includes therians, otherkin, and other identities.
Discomfort that some therians feel for not having the body of their theriotype. Not all therians experience it and its intensity varies.
A therian who experiences their animal identity constantly and not in discrete shifts. Their human and animal mindset are always integrated.

mitos.title: Myths & Facts
mitos.subtitle: We debunk the most common beliefs about the therian community with accurate and respectful information.

myths.reality: Therians know they are human. Therianthropy is an internal identity, not a belief that their body is non-human. It's a deep psychological and/or spiritual connection with an animal.
Many adult therians identified as such since childhood and maintain this identity throughout their lives. The community has members of all ages. It's not something you "outgrow".
The furry fandom is a hobby centered on anthropomorphic characters. Being therian is an identity. Someone can be both, one of the two, or neither. They are different things that sometimes overlap.
The therian community has existed since the 90s on Usenet forums, before social media. Social networks only made it more visible and accessible, they didn't create it.
Therianthropy itself is not a disorder. It doesn't cause inherent dysfunction. Like anyone, therians may need mental health support, but their identity is not a pathology.
Therians are ordinary people who go to school, work and have social lives. Feeling a connection with an animal doesn't imply dangerous behavior. The community promotes respect and safety.
Wearing gear (masks, tails, ears) is completely optional and personal. Many therians don't wear any accessories. There are no rules about how to express your identity.

myths.myth: "They want to be treated like animals"
myths.reality: Therians want to be treated with respect like anyone else. Their identity is internal; they don't ask to be treated literally as animals. They want understanding, not special treatment.

mitos.whyText: Myths and misunderstandings can cause real harm to people. When people don't understand what therianthropy is, it can lead to mockery, exclusion or stigmatization. Educating with accurate and respectful information helps create a more understanding world for everyone.

normas.title: Community Guidelines
normas.subtitle: To keep this space safe and welcoming for everyone, we ask that these guidelines be respected.

values.title: Respect
values.description: Every person deserves to be treated with dignity, regardless of their identity.

values.title: Safety
values.description: This is a space free from harassment, bullying and any form of violence.

values.title: Inclusion
values.description: All identities, ages and experiences are welcome here.

doList: Treat everyone with respect and empathy, even if you don't understand their experience.
Use the pronouns and names each person prefers.
Report inappropriate content instead of confronting directly.
Share your experiences honestly and respectfully.
Keep language appropriate for all ages.
Respect other members' privacy. Don't share their information without permission.
Ask with genuine curiosity if you don't understand something.
dontList: Harassment, bullying, threats or intimidation of any kind.
Discrimination by identity, gender, race, religion, orientation or origin.
Invalidating others' identity ("you're not really therian").
Sharing others' personal information without consent (doxxing).
Creating multiple accounts to evade bans or blocks.
normas.modDesc: Our moderation team works to maintain a safe space. Here's how the process works:

modSteps.title: Report
modSteps.description: A member reports content using the report button.

modSteps.title: Review
modSteps.description: A moderator reviews the report and evaluates the situation.

modSteps.title: Action
modSteps.description: The appropriate measure is taken (warning, mute, suspension or permanent ban).

modSteps.title: Follow-up
modSteps.description: The user is notified and the decision is documented.

consequences.description: First minor offense. The violated rule is explained and they are asked not to repeat it.
Cannot post for a set period (24h - 7 days).
Account temporarily suspended for serious or repeated violations.
In extreme cases or serious recidivism, the account is permanently removed.

normas.contactText: If you see content that violates these guidelines, use the "Report" button available on posts and profiles. Your report is confidential and will be reviewed by our team.
